metadata.h1: How AI Changes the Logistic Industry

all_paragraphs: There are a lot of changes in the logistics industry and supply chain due to the development of artificial intelligence or AI. This powerful technology brings such modifications as predictive analytics, autonomous vehicles, and smart roads.
So, we’ve decided to discuss the top 5 problems that AI can solve in logistics. Moreover, there several startups that implement artificial intelligence.
Due to recent research, implementing artificial intelligence in the supply chain can allow companies to gain from $1.3 trillion to $2 trillion per year.

A lot of enterprises like Google, Amazon, and Intel start to invest their resources into AI. Actually, this technology allows saving time and money because it offers to automate various time-consuming processes.
It’s high time to look through the use cases of artificial intelligence in the logistics field as well as discuss companies that already use this technology on a regular basis.

Nowadays, there is a tendency for AI to transform warehousing operations such as collecting and analyzing information or inventory processing. As a result, AI assists in increasing efficiency and getting profit. How does it work? Artificial intelligence is used to predict the demand for certain products. After that, the company delivers demanding items to the regional warehouses reducing the transportation costs.
According to Vero Solutions, companies can automate 30% of warehousing tasks in the next few years.

Moreover, the system with artificial intelligence can manage the work as well as fulfill various routine tasks. We’ve prepared an example of the company that has implemented AI into the warehousing system and got some profit.

Ocado. It’s an online supermarket that is located in Great Britain. This company has developed an automated warehouse. There is a robot called ‘hive-grid-machine’ that carries off the orders a lot faster then workers do. The numbers are insane. During one week, ‘hive-grid-machine’ can fulfill 65,000 orders or replace 3,5 million grocery items. These robots assist in moving, lifting, and sorting things. After that, the Ocado’s employees pack and send orders. As a result, the time needed to send an order is reduced.

Automated warehouses tend to use computer vision. This technology allows recognizing and organizing the items. Moreover, in the future, computer vision will assist in managing quality control without people’s oversight.If there are several warehouses in the chain, artificial intelligence offers to connect them in order to find the best variant for transporting the inventory.

Artificial intelligence is profitable for transportation. Self-driving vehicles bring changes to the supply chain and help reduce expenses in logistics. Of course, we know about driverless cars but AI allows automating more vehicles. For example, such means of transport as trucks, vans, or buses can also be automated in order to transport goods. Such kinds of vehicles can work alone or cooperate with a person. However, in many countries, the government considers that the driver has to be in the vehicle to fully control the situation on the road and analyze possible risks. Of course, this statement may be changed in the future.

Waymo. In December 2018, this company has integrated a taxi service that utilizes self-driving cars. The service works in the suburbs of Phoenix, Arizona. Nowadays, Waymo tries to build driverless trucks. The company wants to make trucking safer. The revenue of the company is expected to become $114 billion by 2030.

Rolls-Royce. This enterprise cooperates with Intel in order to develop autonomous ships. Rolls-Royce has been creating this technology since the 2010s. So, Intelligence Awareness was released in 2018. This tool has several interesting features. For example, it can recognize and define objects in the water, monitor engine condition, and choose the optimal routes. As a result, the delivery speed becomes higher.

There are a lot of benefits that driverless technology can bring to logistics. For example, utilizing self-driving vehicles, people get an opportunity to reduce fuel usage, optimize routes as well as avoid human mistakes.

In addition to driverless cars, there is one more use case of AI in logistics. Several companies are working on building smart roads. These companies tend to create various solutions in order to satisfy regional needs.

For example, there are roads developed with solar panels and LED lights. What is profit for the logistics sector? Such highways can produce electricity or use colorful lights to pay drivers’ attention to the changing road conditions. One more benefit is the ability of solar panels to heat. As a result, the roads aren’t slippery in the winter.
All the mentioned benefits lead to the conclusion that smart roads are useful for the logistics field. Since there are no delivery delays in the supply chain due to inappropriate weather conditions.

Integrated Roadways. The company is famous for creating the Smart Pavement system. Integrated Roadways’ owners have signed an agreement with the Colorado Department of Transportation in order to test this technology. The Smart Pavement System has several useful features. Firstly, it’s able to connect the cars on the road to the Internet. As a result, drivers can have real-life information about traffic jams, accidents, and so on. Moreover, the creators consider that their system can ‘feel’ the position of every vehicle and provide drivers with detailed navigation.

Back office operations are vital for the logistics sector. Such technologies as AI and RPA (Robotic Process Automation) allow employees to speed up the working processes. For example, there are some data-related tasks that repeat every day. They can be automated. The companies with supply chains can save time and money since back office automation.

The combination of AI and RPA created a technology called cognitive automation. As a result, companies get an opportunity to save time, increase productivity and accuracy. The main aim of this technology is to replace some categories of employees, e.g. accountants, human resources, etc. Due to this replacement, the number of human errors will reduce.

UiPath. The company specializes in robotic equipment. According to the owners, robots are able to do 99% of tasks if the employee asks. It happens because UiPath’s robots can ‘see’ the screen elements.

The latest research claims that robots can manage 22% of the lawyer’s job. Of course, such tasks as reading the agreements and identifying risky clauses are time-consuming. AI-powered contract management software is an opportunity to save time and increase accuracy. LawGeex claims that AI apps show 94% of accuracy while human lawyers — 85%. Moreover, the system reviews contracts faster. According to the same research, the software needs only 26 seconds but a person spends 92 seconds.

Leverton. This company develops AI-powered software. For example, there’s a contract analytics software that can manage agreements and support approximately 30 languages. Additionally, it’s possible to teach this tool to extract necessary information from documents. Leverton claims that this technology allows saving from 30% to 50% of working time.
Artificial intelligence in the logistics sector has one quite obvious use case. This technology can assist in predicting demand.

Of course, companies need to predict the approximate number of goods to speed up delivery. In another case, if there’s a limited amount of goods but the demand is high, the business will lose some money.

There are some algorithms that can predict trends. According to recent studies, AI-based tools tend to predict better than human specialists.Artificial intelligence allows following the necessary factors to increase the accuracy of demand prediction. After that, this information can make warehouse management easier.
Additionally, AI improves customer experience. Due to the implementation of this technology, clients can get a more personalized experience and, as a result, trust the company more.

DHL. Amazon and DHL Parcel have signed an agreement. They cooperate in order to increase customer experience. So, Amazon has created a voice-based service called Alexa. It was taught to answer questions about parcels, e.g. shipment details, whereabouts, and so on. Alexa is quite simple to use. The person can ask ‘Alexa, where is my parcel?’ and receive all necessary details.

As you can see, there are a lot of AI use cases in the logistics field. Nowadays, this powerful technology is developing to improve logistics and supply chains in particular. Artificial intelligence allows automating routine tasks that take a lot of time.
Startups bring a lot of innovations. So, we’ve created a list of several promising startup companies that try to integrate artificial intelligence in the logistics.

6 River System works on the warehouse automation. The company has created a robot called Chuck. The creators have used technologies similar to self-driving vehicles. So, Chuck is connected to the Management System. The robot can perform such tasks as putting things away, counting and even sorting them.
Moreover, Chuck is wireless and movable. As a result, it shifts among boxes easily and may even slow down when employees or equipment are on its way.
One more startup company that wants to automate warehouses. Locus Robotics builds mobile robots that make e-commerce operations easier. The company’s robot is called LocusBot.
The robot has an integrated touch-pad based user interface. So, the time spent on training the employees to cooperate with LocusBot reduces.

Transmetrics tents to build AI solutions for the transportation and logistics industries. The company provides clients with modern technologies, e.g. predictive optimization, advanced forecasting, and so on. As a result, companies operations are more efficient.

The transportation field requires modern technical solutions. Valerann has developed a smart road system. It’s a wireless network that collects high-resolution information. This data is stored in the cloud and analyzed. As a result, AI-based algorithms offer an opportunity to track the road conditions and predict the situation on the highways.

There are many startups that work on creating driverless cars. Optimus Ride builds software and hardware solutions that can cooperate with any vehicle type. The company’s leaders claim that their solutions are good for many locations, such as residential communities, industrial parks, airports, and so on.

This company specializes in developing solutions for marketplaces, warehouses, as well as e-commerce companies. The final goal of the startup is to create a technical solution that provides users with the most suitable delivery option. As a result, the shipping process will be easy and comfortable. Shippo has already created several solutions, e.g. clients can get personalized tracking data, customize delivery and so on.

So, we’ve just discussed six promising startups that integrate artificial intelligence in the logistics field and supply chain. Every company uses a unique method of implementing AI. Of course, the list isn’t completed and can be extended with more startup companies.

Artificial intelligence can be beneficial for the logistics sector. First of all, this technology increases the effectiveness and accuracy of any logistics operation. Secondly, AI allows automating time-consuming tasks and reducing the final cost.
